value.excerpt: World in 2021 has seemingly gone mad with censorship, over regulations, and so called “cancel  culture. ”  So, how can disruptive startups circumvent these new developments, and continue to innovate and create economic growth with AI?

value.title: Artificial Intelligence Ranks Moderna And IBM Among Trending Stocks
value.excerpt: Q.ai runs daily factor models to get the most up-to-date reading on stocks and ETFs. This time, our artificial intelligence systems have identified Moderna and IBM among other trending stocks.

value.title: Tesla admits totally self-driving cars likely aren't happening in 2021
value.excerpt: An Autopilot engineer told California regulators Tesla may not achieve Level 5 autonomy, despite what CEO Elon Musk predicted in January.

value.title: Artificial intelligence makes great microscopes better than ever
value.excerpt: To observe the swift neuronal signals in a fish brain, scientists have started to use a technique called light-field microscopy, which makes it possible to image such fast biological processes in 3D.

value.title: Tesla is more cautious about Full Self-Driving timeline with regulators than the public, based on new memo
value.excerpt: Tesla is being a little more cautious about its Full Self-Driving timeline with regulators than with the public, according to a newly released memo from a meeting between Tesla and the California DMV.

value.title: Five ways to protect sensitive data in your organization

value.title: The autonomous vehicle world is shrinking — it’s overdue
value.excerpt: After years of positive vibes about the future of autonomous vehicles and nearly unrestricted access to cash from Kool-Aid-drunk venture capitalists, the AV industry is confronting some hard truths. The first is that autonomous vehicles are going to take a lot longer to reach mass scale than previously thought.

value.title: Samsung develops an innovative I-Cube4 chip packaging technology: Faster & Efficient
value.excerpt: Amidst the global chip shortage, leading chipmaker Samsung has announced a new chip packaging technology. Potentially, the new technology could yield more efficient and faster chips using an innovative chip-packing technique.

value.title: IBM's new 2-nm chips have transistors smaller than a strand of DNA
value.excerpt: In a shining example of the inexorable march of technology, IBM has unveiled new semiconductor chips with the smallest transistors ever made. The new 2-nanometer (nm) tech allows the company to cram a staggering 50 billion transistors onto a chip the size of a fingernail.

value.title: Researchers say this combo of old-school invisible ink and AI is ‘uncrackable’
value.excerpt: A team of researchers from the Harbin Institute of Technology in China have developed a system by which invisible ink and a basic cipher can be combined with relatively simple AI to create an ‘uncrackable’ offline encryption method.

value.title: How the USPS uses Nvidia GPUs and A.I. to track missing mail
value.excerpt: You've got mail! But where is it? The USPS is leaning on A.I. at the edge and GPU-accelerated computing to help track and locate missing mail and packages.
